What To Expect In Western Power Markets This Summer Conference and Other Upcoming EventsElectric Power Industry Colleague Soaring natural gas prices heat waves plant outages low hydropower availability capacity shortages many unexpected factors combined to s end Western power prices upward last summer In addition to fundamental factors flaws in market rules and market power are also considered by many observer s to have been significant causes Western power markets continued to hold surprises in the fall and winter as lower load levels did not result in t he expected moderation of prices Unprecedented gas market price spikes and a credit crisis due to the nearbankruptcy of California utilities were add ed to the complex mix of market drivers Electric Utility Consultants Inc Register Now Last Week for Early Bird Special Transmission Grid Expansion and System Reliability ConferencesGrid Expansion and System Reliability Conferences May Denver Colorado Overview The conferences focus on the Regulatory Issues and Pricing of Transmission The conferences also have a strong focus on enabling transmission technologies These advanced transmission technologies promise market participants speed and flexibility towards achieving their goals of enhancing system capacity responding to price incentives and increasing system reliability In the post FERC era the industry participants are looking for clear guidelines on regulation and pricing A well defined regulatory and pricin g structure would allow them to pursue their business models without compromising the reliability of the national electric grid The crisis in California reinforces the need for these clear guidelines While the rules of the game are still not as clear as many would like it and while there a re vast differences in approach in different regions some areas of consensus have emerged among market participants and regulators The industry experts participating in this conference provide a focus group for identifying area s of consensus The conference participants will also be able to form opinio ns on areas where regulation is not addressing the issues and need to be addressed Participants will also come away with a good appreciation of wh at is technologically feasible to meet their business goals The brochure for the conferences and associated workshop is attached Last Week to Receive Early Bird Discount for Distribution Companies ConferencePerformance Management for Electric Distribution Companies An Executive Forum October Atlanta GA OVERVIEW Deregulation is introducing competition into the electric utility industry in an everincreasing rate and it is requiring companies to consider dramatic changes in their business processes in the operation of their businesses and in managing their assets Issues such as customer satisfaction performance based rates operational reliability targets operational efficiencies risk management and rate reductions are among the new business drivers With the advent of new choices open to the smallest retail customers as well as the largest industrials distribution companies are reengineering their businesses and reestablishing their corporate priorities in response to these new challenges This new business environment has brought performance management to the forefront for the electric distribution companies and they are being driven by regulators customers and financial rating agencies to improve all aspects of their performance Through this conference we have gathered leading executives from distribution companies wires companies generation companies energy marketers regulators and market participants to openly discuss the issues their experiences and their corporate strategies Our objective for this executive forum is to provide you with new insights into how electric distribution companies are addressing these issues and concerns and to help you formulate your own corporate approach to this challenging and complex new world The website link for the conference is provided below Please click the link to see the program agenda general information including location and hotel and online registration You can also register by calling us at Performance Management for Electric Distribution Companies October Atlanta GA confoverviewaspConfID Ancillary Services Conference October November Denver CO OVERVIEW The Ancillary Services conference will explore the rapidly changing and fascinating engineering economic market and policy issues related to bulkpower ancillary services These issues are difficult to resolve because these services are essential for both reliability and commerce and it is often difficult to disentangle the two Topics to be covered at this event include centralized vs supplier unit commitment integration of ancillaryservice markets with energy and congestion markets relationships among forward and realtime markets measuring the performance of ancillaryservice delivery operating costs to provide these services retailload provision of some ancillary services comparisons among the existing ISOs and future RTOs in their treatment of ancillary services and the feasibility of letting price influence the amount of reserves acquired Electric Utility Consultants Inc a longtime provider of timely conferences and workshops
